body_html:
@siddharthkhullar Given those config values, your /usr/local/cuda directory presumably contains a CUDA8.0 SDK installation and header files.
In this case, /usr/local/cuda/extras/CUPTI/lib64 should be on your LD_LIBRARY_PATH and should (typically) contain a libcupti.so symlink pointing to a libcupti.so.8.0
body_text:
@siddharthkhullar Given those config values, your /usr/local/cuda directory presumably contains a CUDA8.0 SDK installation and header files.
In this case, /usr/local/cuda/extras/CUPTI/lib64 should be on your LD_LIBRARY_PATH and should (typically) contain a libcupti.so symlink pointing to a libcupti.so.8.0
body:
@siddharthkhullar Given those config values, your `/usr/local/cuda` directory presumably contains a CUDA8.0 SDK installation and header files.
In this case, `/usr/local/cuda/extras/CUPTI/lib64` should be on your `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` and should (typically) contain a `libcupti.so` symlink pointing to a `libcupti.so.8.0`
